Getting back to the topic of the Muslim girl in Michigan, she ultimately wound up cutting me off and deleting perhaps all traces of any online presence she had. Quite simply, she had enough, and in hindsight? I don't blame her. She did that not only for herself, but also for me.

Fast forward to today and I look at situations like Palestine. The horrors of war, and the people trying to escape it. I was challenged to imagine this innocent Muslim girl suffering in those conditions, and then it clicked. I needed to learn about these different walks of life, LGBTQ included.

Deep in my heart, I knew that people came from all walks of life. There's more than 8 billion going on 8.5 billion people in this world, and for some reason, I took the time to be a complete asshole to just one of them, for the simple fact that they were Muslim. It is perhaps my ugliest regret.
